Package ca.cgjennings.ui.fcpreview

Class ImagePreviewer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ca.cgjennings.ui.fcpreview.ImagePreviewer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameComponentPreviewer, ResourcePreviewer
    public class ImagePreviewer
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A generic preview panel that can display previews based on arbitrary "resource pointers". These are usually files, but can be any object. This class handles image files; subclasses can override isResourceTypeSupported(java.lang.Object) and createPreviewImage(java.lang.Object) to support other types of resource pointers or resource types.

    A special constructor allows use as a self-installing file chooser accessory.

    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Chris Jennings
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getLoadProgressDelay

        public final int getLoadProgressDelay()
        Returns the current load delay, in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the delay before a load animation is shown
        See Also:
        setLoadProgressDelay(int)

      • setLoadProgressDelay

        public final void setLoadProgressDelay​(int loadIconDelayInMilliseconds)
        Sets the delay to allow loading the preview image before an animated delay indicated is shown. Note that this should not be set too high, as the event dispatch thread will be blocked for this duration when the selection changes.
        Parameters:
        loadIconDelayInMilliseconds - the delay before a load animation is shown

      • setZoomable

        public void setZoomable​(boolean zoomable)

      • isZoomable

        public boolean isZoomable()

      • createPreviewImage

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage createPreviewImage​(java.lang.Object f)
        Creates the preview image from the target file. Subclasses should override this to create a custom previewer for a different file type. Note that this is typically not run from the event dispatch thread. If constructing the image fails for any reason, this method must return null and should not display an error message.
        Parameters:
        f - the file to compose a preview of
        Returns:
        the preview image

      • isResourceTypeSupported

        public boolean isResourceTypeSupported​(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if this file appears to be of a type for which a preview can be created.
        Parameters:
        o - the file to check
        Returns:
        true if previewing this file is expected to succeed
